SqlRetryLogicBaseProvider.summary: Applies retry logic on an operation through the `Execute` or `ExecuteAsync` function.

Retrying.summary: Occurs before applying the calculated delay time and executing the function on a next attempt.
Retrying.value: with event argument of object can be subscribed.

remarks.format: > [IMPORTANT!] > Don't block execution with a time consuming action when an event occurs. For instance, if you log data to a file, run it in a new thread to avoid blocking the main execution thread.

RetryLogic.summary: Defines the retry logic used to decide when to retry based on the encountered exception.

remarks.format: > [!NOTE] > The `RetryLogic` property is assigned at `SqlRetryLogicBaseProvider` creation and its value is used as a template internally. Don't use it to monitor the status of the retry logic during and after execution. Instead, use the <xref=E:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlRetryLogicBaseProvider.Retrying> event to collect data about retry executions.

Execute.typeparam: The object that the `function` returns when executed.
Execute.param: The operation to re-execute if a transient condition occurs.
Execute.summary: Executes a function and applies retry logic, if enabled. **Note:** Exceptions will be reported via an aggregate exception if the execution isn't successful via retry attempts.
Execute.returns: The return value of the `function` if it runs without exception.

remarks.format: > [!NOTE] > The type of exception depends on the `function`'s internal implementation. But if the exception is due to all retry attempts failing, it will be an <xref:System.AggregateException> that consists of all exceptions that happened during the failed attempts.

Execute.exception: The collection of exceptions after all retry attempts have failed.

ExecuteAsync1.typeparam: The object that the `function` returns in a Task when executed.
ExecuteAsync1.param: The operation to re-execute if a transient condition occurs.
ExecuteAsync1.summary: Executes a function and applies retry logic, if enabled. The cancellation token can be used to request that the operation be abandoned before the execution attempts are exceeded. **Note:** Exceptions will be reported via the returned Task object, which will contain an aggregate exception if execution fails for all retry attempts.
ExecuteAsync1.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The results of the task will be the return value of the `function`, if it runs without exception.

remarks.format: > [!NOTE] > If the exception comes from all retry attempts failing, it will be an <xref:System.AggregateException> that consists of all exceptions from the failed attempts.

ExecuteAsync1.exception: The collection of exceptions after failed retry attempts.

ExecuteAsync2.param: The operation to re-execute if a transient condition occurs.
ExecuteAsync2.summary: Executes a function and applies retry logic, if enabled. The cancellation token can be used to request that the operation be abandoned before the execution attempts are exceeded. **Note:** Exceptions will be reported via the returned Task object, which will contain an aggregate exception if execution fails for all retry attempts.

remarks.format: > [!NOTE] > If the exception comes from all retry attempts failing, it will be an <xref:System.AggregateException> that consists of all exceptions from the failed attempts.

ExecuteAsync2.exception: The collection of exceptions after failed retry attempts.
